meanings.definition: To write or inscribe letters on something again.
meanings.sent1: She spent the afternoon relettering the old sign with fresh paint.
meanings.sent2: The artist is relettering the title of the painting to make it more legible.
meanings.sent3: After relettering the menu, the restaurant accidentally misspelled 'sandwich' as 'sandwic'.
meanings.sent4: Relettering the message on the card felt like rewriting history itself.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demonstrated relettering the alphabet on the chalkboard for the students.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the letters on a sign or object.
meanings.sent1: The relettering of the store sign attracted more customers with its new design.
meanings.sent2: The relettering of the street name caused confusion among the residents.
meanings.sent3: The relettering of the license plate made it look like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The relettering of the logo transformed the company's image completely.
meanings.sent5: The relettering of the book cover gave it a fresh and modern look.

meanings.definition: The process of rearranging or replacing letters in a word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: The relettering of the anagram revealed the hidden message within the jumble of letters.
meanings.sent2: The relettering of the password made it more secure and difficult to guess.
meanings.sent3: During the relettering of the crossword puzzle, the words became even more challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: The relettering of the code transformed the encrypted message into plain text.
meanings.sent5: The relettering of the slogan gave the campaign a fresh and catchy appeal.
